titles.title: Providing for the consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-8, by Mrs. Myrick.

The resolution provides that the following bills and resolutions may be considered under suspension of the rules at any time on the legislative day of Wednesday, March 7, 2001: H. Con. Res. 31; H.R. 624; H. Con. Res. 47.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 3.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 78.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/6/2001--Reported to House without amendment. Makes it in order at any time on March 7, 2001, for the Speaker of the House of Representatives to entertain motions that the House suspend the rules relating to specified measures.
